definition[0]: to make someone feel unhappy and weak
example[0]: Joe’s been ill for weeks now – it’s really dragging him down.
definition[1]: to make the price, level, or quality of something go down
example[1]: Declining prices for aluminium have dragged down the company’s earnings.
definition[2]: if someone or something bad drags you down, they make you become worse or get into a worse situation
example[2]: Don’t let them drag you down to their level.
